verbs.description: primp (third-person singular simple present primps, present participle primping, simple past and past participle primped)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To spend time improving one's appearance, often in front of a mirror.
examples: "Then I promise I'll let you take your bath and primp all day for your date."

entries.meaning: (transitive) To dress in an affected manner.
examples: Tonight, Moses was the center of attraction, attended to by a dozen Green Berets who prepped and primped him like a stage crew fluttering about a Hollywood star.
